website_summaries.verdict: These headphones are your best option if you're looking for noise-cancelling earbuds, but they are pricey.
pros: Stay Hear tips keep earbuds in your ears while maximizing comfort
cons: These are expensive for earbuds, so you should only buy them if you're going to use them often

website_summaries.verdict: Despite some downsides, including a high price, the Bose QuietComfort 20 offers the best noise-canceling in an in-ear headphone and should tempt frequent travelers looking for a more compact alternative to a full-size NC headphone, such as the Bose QuietComfort 15.
pros: The Bose QuietComfort 20 and 20i are compact in-ear headphones that sound good, are very comfortable to wear, and offer surprisingly impressive noise cancellation
The noise cancellation is powered by an integrated rechargeable lithium battery that delivers up to 16 hours of battery life
cons: they don't sound as good as many competing in-ear headphones in this price range

website_summaries.verdict: The Bose QuietComfort 20 is a giant leap forward for noise cancellation earphones, and easily the most effective pair we have tested thus far.
pros: The best noise cancellation circuitry on the market
Rich bass response and crisp highs
cons: Sound signature is very sculpted, and not for purists
Light on accessories like extra eartips

customer_reviews.title: Love-hate relationship: falls apart within 2 years
customer_reviews.text: These are quite comfortable and the noise cancellation is very good. I even think they sound pretty good generally (though not the best according to my audiophile friends). So good that I use them. A lot. Unfortunately, I am now on my third pair in four years. Like clockwork, after about two years, the cables start to fray at all major connection points (see attached picture). Conveniently after the warranty expires. Not sure if it is bad design or designed obsolescence. They do offer modest discounts on the return, so I appreciate that. But it is a mighty expensive product for it to fail so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Grimm

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like this is a common problem
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Bose QC20 a little over a year ago and the left speaker stopped working. Sounds like this is a common problem. Very unhappy since I paid about $300 for these.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Palleschi

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this product unless you can afford to by this ...
customer_reviews.text: Just went through my second pair of Bose QuietComfort 20 Acoustic Noise cancelling ear buds. No matter how careful I am in handling them they break. Plug them into my audio device and only remove them for charging. Both pair only last about a year. To expensive to by on a yearly basis. Long time Bose advocate and bose customer. I don't recommend this product unless you can afford to by this product once a year.
customer_reviews.author: michael r. riley

customer_reviews.title: Volume Controls Do NOT Work w/Lightning Adapter
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT work with lightning adapters. I ordered two headphones - one pre-owned, then a new one - as well as several Apple-certified adapters, but the volume control never worked on any combination. I finally called Bose today (May 16, 2018). The rep ultimately said it's intended to work with "older" iPhones that have the 3.5mm jack, despite it being touted as an iPhone model. I've been a Bose customer for many years, but this was my last interaction with the company. No more.
customer_reviews.author: Carla M.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 8 months use.
customer_reviews.text: They worked great while they worked, but now after only 8 months of use they have failed completely. I now get no noise reduction at all. They still work as EarPods, but do not work at all for noise cancelling! It seems to me that something costing this much should work longer than 8 months! Would certainly not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Emesewe

customer_reviews.title: Not useful on airlines - get the headphones
customer_reviews.text: If you’re thinking of getting these to use on airlines – don’t. Get the over the ear headphones instead:  I’ve tried both these Bose earbuds and the Bose headphones on the same flight. On a scale from one to ten, I’d give the earbuds about a three and a half and the headphones a nine plus. The earbuds had minimal noise cancellation while the headphones were magic. Watching a film on my iPad with the headphones was like being in my own hushed movie theater.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bevitt

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound But Durability is Questionable
customer_reviews.text: These are my husband's and he just had to buy a new pair because they are just out of warranty. Sound is great, but the wiring apparently got tweaked so sound only comes out of one bud, unless you wiggle the wires. He's going to see if they can be fixed, but for a set of buds this expensive, you'd expect them to be more durable. In looking at the cables, you can't see any wear, as he doesn't use them very often.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Salcido

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with iphone 11 unless you buy an adapter
customer_reviews.text: Bose is misleading you that this is out of the box compatible with iphone. The earbuds need an adapter THAT YOU HAVE TO BUY SEPARATELY in order to work with an iphone 11. Says nothing about this on the site. I have owned many Bose products and have been happy with them until now. Their response to my query was basically: it's your problem. I pay $250 for earbuds advertised for apple products and it doesn't fit out of the box with an iphone 11? I have to shell out more money for an adapter? C'mon Bose, you can do better than that. I'm a very displeased customer and am returning the earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Diana  B. Ingraham

customer_reviews.title: They cancel noise!
customer_reviews.text: So far I love them. I cannot believe how well they drown out noise on a plane - it made many long flights more pleasant and possible to sleep. Yesterday I put them in my ears, with noise canceling on, but not even plugged in, and they did an excellent job masking my snoring partner :) I generally hate headphones but they are super comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Great product, horrible manufacturing.
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancelling feature on these headphones work incredibly well. The sound however is good. Not amazing. However, that's not why I'm writing this review. I ordered these headphones 3 different times, and they were all defective. Great product, but horrible manufacturing. The plug will cut in and out if you wiggle it around, and the volume controls/mic don't work most of the time. Will not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Ryan T Ragle

customer_reviews.title: Only for iPhones 6 or Older
customer_reviews.text: No where on the website or reviews does it say this will only work with iPhones 6 or older without having an adapter. Before I bought them I looked carefully for this knowing iPhones changed their headset ports, but everything says these work for all apple products. It wasn't until I received them and open the box that I realized they have the wrong connection. The large print on the box says for iPhones but the small print says for 6 or older. Would have been nice to know this before I spent all this money. I don't want to have an adapter attached to these as it is one more thing to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: these earbuds work wonderfully IMHO for noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Be aware...these earbuds work wonderfully IMHO for noise cancellation, especially on flights and noisy airports. The problem I have is that BOTH earbud plastic encasements began to separate -- thereby coming apart to the extent that the earbud wiring is exposed. I've tried using super glue (works), but eventually they separate again. I've contacted BOSE and am hoping (upon hope) that they will address this. Not sure my warranty is current enough for replacements, however, I'm thinking that the plastic earbuds should NOT separate at the seams. Really bad manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: jerzygrl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! ... until the buzzing started
customer_reviews.text: The noise canceling these provide is better than anything I have tried, including over-ear headphones of the same brand. Leaf blowers, motorcycles, my neighbors being abhorrent, and airplane passenger noise all practically disappear. They are comfortable and high quality earbuds even when not switched into noise canceling mode. I take very good care of my things. I haven't abused these. To my dismay they started to emit a painful buzzing while in noise canceling mode. It's intermittent and not obviously caused by motion. I wish they would fix it and come out with a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: H.L.

customer_reviews.title: Caution! Poor quality... Huge price.
customer_reviews.text: My first pair had an issue with the lights not working correctly. But it didn't seem to affect the performance of the headphones really so I just went with it. I lost them on a trip shortly after. So I bit the bullet and got another pair. These were great... Until the warranty ran out. Now they won't stop blinking and popping when turned off. Thus they won't hold a charge and are basically garbage now. For the huge price you pay I expected these to last for A VERY long time. Clearly the quality just isn't there. A big waist of money.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Hickman

customer_reviews.title: this is worth than the overhead q35 updated for quality
customer_reviews.text: i had the overhead 35ii, but noise cancelling is my first priority. and i promise this headset is doing much better on noise cancelling if this is also what you looking for. This is updated part, After a few week, this part is loosing like the post picture, I had the same one from target long time ago, but it only happens after years using ...
customer_reviews.author: Linou

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best headphones out there
customer_reviews.text: I read some of these reviews and wonder if they bought the same product. These headphones are absolutely the best I’ve ever had. Great sound, and great noise cancellation. So people don’t like that they are connect to your phone but I’ve lost so many wireless earbuds I’m over it. Super comfortable in your ears and the battery life is really good. I ran them wide open on a six hour flight with no issues. I have apple ear buds, Jaybirds, and those big ass Bose headphones. By far I like these the best.
customer_reviews.author: MAM 8670

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am tremendously pleased with this purchase. I wanted a compact noise canceling headphone and this is a wonderful product. The earpieces fit well and it comes with multiple sizes. They provide clear sound. The case is compact and everything fits well inside. When using as a headset for my computer's Skype session, I'm able to hear everyone clearly; however, those on the other side do have some difficulty understanding or hearing me. I'm not sure if this is attributed to the device or my computer. I have even worn these to sleep in without them being plugged into a device for music. Drowned out snoring well! :D Overall - love the product
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.text: These were great.... While the actually worked. I had these for a little over a year and a half before they stopped working. The noise cancellation and sounds quality were great. I fly weekly and these were a great product to block out the noise. However, they stopped working with normal use after a short time. I would expect a longer product life for this price. Bose support offered no remedy to the failed product, only a small discount to purchase from them again. Not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Sipplry

customer_reviews.title: Battery life under 8 hrs
customer_reviews.text: Bought item on October 2017 and have used it 8 to 10 times for international travel If head pieces are fitted tightly the noise canceling is quite good ie eliminates about 85 to 90 percent of the background noise Battery lifetime has shortened significantly since I got it from Amazon Now have to plug it in to the USB port in order to use on flight from Europe Reducing to one star because battery life time now 6 hours and very poor customer service from Bose
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Sucker bait
customer_reviews.text: As many reviewers have noted these will probably fall apart or otherwise stop working shortly after the warranty period. Mine did. You’ve been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly thought the noise cancellation would be a gimmick. But it’s not, and it is now my new standard for excellence in headphones. Bose noice cancellation really do separate out external noise from the internal, or content sounds. Music and podcasts both sound richer and clearer, as background noises such as cars, people, and traffic just sound like a soft whir in the background. This way, you can concentrate on the music or voice so much easier. Plus, the earbud style of headphone are inconspicuous, but are extremely comfortable to wear during hikes or other activities. I think these are even better than the large can style of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Rosscoe

customer_reviews.title: Meh!
customer_reviews.text: A sound engineer/ songwriter, i chose these headphones ONLY for noise reduction on flights. I have NO interest in listening to music on flights and found the eq of the sound to ne bass heavy (extremely). I would have preferred the left and right sides be different colors or differentiated in a clear way. I dont find the fit to be comfortable. I’m okay with spending $250 on headphones so price is not the issue; but imo these are overpriced for what one gets.
customer_reviews.author: Odysseus King

customer_reviews.title: SO easy to travel with these!
customer_reviews.text: I am an occasional international traveler. I used to borrow a traditional headset for my long flights but always found them slightly awkward. There is so little space to maneuver once you're seated, and dealing with case, getting up to use the restroom, moving so OTHERS can get up to use the restroom, was a tad annoying. This headset is ultra compact and can fit in a small purse or large pocket. The diminutive buds are really light weight so it was easy to find a spot where I could drape them when leaving my seat. Oh, and the noise cancelling is amazing! Just remember that the plane adapter isn't included, you need to order one separately.
customer_reviews.author: E Martinson

customer_reviews.title: Environmental isolator!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic noise cancelling. Use primarily for 2 applications. Can drive in my car at 75mph with the windows open with virtually no wind noise. Also use when I'm mowing my lawn with a very loud tractor. My hearing will deteriorate at a slower pace because of my use of the Bose. Don't use for working out/dog walks. Wires would be intrusive. That said, a wired headset is still the most reliable connection available. Have BT headsets and they're not as reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: It blocks ambient sound just fine, but does so with what feels like increased pressure in my ears. It takes some getting used to and can even be uncomfortable at times. I'm surprised and concerned that all the reviews I read about these don't mention this effect from the noise canceling.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher L. Gainey

customer_reviews.title: Extraordinary!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine for a while now, and they simply are the best! Clear and crisp, with excellent noise cancellation. I spend a lot of time in the air, and I won’t get on a plane without them. Crying babies? Not a problem. Small and loud propeller plane? Can’t hear a thing. Only problem is that when the flight attendant comes by or there is an announcement I can miss them because I can’t hear anything except what’s on my iPhone. (There’s a button that turns off the noise canceling if needed.) A bit expensive, but well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Akaya

customer_reviews.title: the best..
customer_reviews.text: Of course Bose is Bose.......the best.....the best sound. The amplifier and noise cancelling is perfect. But the rubberized cable is just bad. I can see the rubber covering on the cable is already loose and with multiple roll-folding etc. it will tear off. I really wish there was a protective cover or spring or something available for the wire. Such an expensive earphone and the inferior quality wiring rubber cover is just a cheap "plan" to have it degrade faster and make customer buy new ones more. Not happy with the wire rubber quality. That is why i gave it a 4. For sound quality definitely a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Arvind Tirkey

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.text: Work great on an airplane. Being able to turn off the Noise cancelling very quick with the push of a button is a great help. Held battery for two 5 hour flights. Small to fit easily in a backpack and in the seat back on the airplane. I do not know how these will hold up after some time, as I just got them for recent air travel. I use wireless (Bluetooth) for all of my running, so I do not know how that would work out. I really like how they fit in my ears, without making them hot and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great noise-canceling quality
customer_reviews.text: Great noise-canceling quality, but two fundamental problems: (1) the bulky battery case is awkwardly positioned and makes these headphones really only useful for airplanes and (2) the ear buds are extremely uncomfortable after a few hours of wearing. The battery life, at least, is far superior than the truly awful Bluetooth version of these.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin, Simon, Fyodor

customer_reviews.title: Truly - Noise Canceling!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, these make traveling a joy. They cut out the noises that ruin your trip, whether the roar of the engines on a plane or the racket of trains, subways, whatever. It's amazing. The quality of sound is so fine and you can choose to block it all out, or not. At home, I use them when my teenagers have all their friends over. They are great for phone calls as well, as you can block the extraneous noises when you need to.
customer_reviews.author: M. Todd

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones for specific activities
customer_reviews.text: These headphones had some great sound. I loved the noise cancelling and they they are small and easy to pack. I did end up returning them because trying to use them on the go, I.e. while walking around town or in a day to day situation didn’t work for me. The control box was the real deal breaker. Hard to take in and out of pocket while attached to my phone. Definitely go for these if you are just using them on planes or at a desk where you don’t have to pull them in and out of a pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Whelan

customer_reviews.title: Life changing!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these headsets regularly for 2.5 years and they are a significant improvement to my life. On all flights, and I fly internationally about twice a year) they transform the experience into being so much more peaceful. Engine noise is reduced incredibly - not silent but maybe like 90%. Movies can be listened to at much lower volume and I can hear them. One summer I drove a noisy car cross country and on the interstate listened to music through teh headsets and it was quiet like a luxury car. I regularly use them at my desk while working.The office air conditioner fan noise is all but eliminated making it much easir to concentrate.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: These cut out about 40% of the sound which I love. I also own Bose headphone version of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have hyperacusis, a noise sensitivity. These cut out about 40% of the sound which I love. I also own Bose headphone version of the noise cancellation devices. I love them both and each have there place. The ear buds hurt my ears if I wear them too much but are easier to wear when I am lying down or when I want to be less conspicuous. I love the button to turn the noise cancellation on and off when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Duck

customer_reviews.title: These are very convenient and are fairly comfortable. They come with different size ear plugs but ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for air travel. These are very convenient and are fairly comfortable. They come with different size ear plugs but I do not find them as comfortable as I had hoped for four hours of listening. I do still get background noise unlike an over the year model so it really comes down to whether you want the convenience of size over the sound quality. Even with the drawbacks I still prefer these over a large bulky set.
customer_reviews.author: In Fashion

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my Beats headphones are so huge to keep in my laptop bag or take on trips with me. I've had several friends swear by them and now I see why - they sound incredible, lightweight, small & compact case and the noise-cancelling is fantastic for flights with crying kids on them, or just working in a noisy office. The only tip I have is be careful unpacking them - they have small, medium & large ear adapters and when I tried to remove the small ones from their packaging I accidentally tore the triangle-shaped part of it. I found that the medium size works perfectly anyway and never falls out, even when running with them.
customer_reviews.author: mikev

customer_reviews.title: Bose QuietComfort 20 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Earbuds are great!
customer_reviews.text: The in-ear Bose Noise Cancelling headphones are much more comfortable than the original Bose headsets that fit over your ears and are just as effective at canceling the outside noise. Also, you can fold them up and stick them in your pocket rather than having to carry around a case. These are just much more convenient and take up less space. The only negative is that the iPhone 7 has no place to plug into, so the earbuds are only good for devices you can plug them into, including iPhone 6 and below, airplane entertainment systems, etc.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Not the usual Bose quality
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with these for a number of reasons. They feel really flimsy and fragile, the cables are so delicate. The white-noise they make when switched on is really quite loud and much more noticeable than other Bose noise-cancelling headphones I own and use. The buds are bigger than I was expecting and stick a long way out of my ears whilst wearing them making them impossible to sleep with. On the plus side, their sound quality is excellent, but for the high price they are just a bit too flawed.
customer_reviews.author: Sammie D

customer_reviews.title: Best noise cancelling headphones with 1 issue
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely adored these noise cancelling headphones. I suffer from migraines and I really need to be able to use noise cancelling headphones to concentrate and not hear all the background noise in my open office. They charge quickly and the battery lasts a long time. The quality of music is very good. I gave it 2 stars because exactly 3 weeks after reaching 1 full year the headphones have broken apart. For the price they are they should either offer a longer term warranty or offer to fix them. I had to re-purchase them because I cannot really work without them. I have tried other ones and I hoped I could do without them. However I am pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Features Great-Quality NOT
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound and really amazing elimination of surrounding noise. Very lousy realizability. About to go for my third replacement. After about three months the first ones charging port would not seat with the cable so any move would stop charging the battery. Now my second pair, only fifteen days old, is starting to make a buzzing noise. Bose is very customer friendly but they have to be sent off and after they get verification of shipment a new one is shipped. It takes about 7 days to get the replacement. I use these a lot for the noise cancellation feature and I'm tired of being without them. A lot of trouble for a high end listening device.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but take a little getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, but take a little getting used to. I did experience a little nausea and dizziness the first few times I used these, but you adjust. I am hypersensitive to noise and motion and I have done fine once I have adjusted to these. They sound great and the ear buds fit excellent. They look large and unwieldy, but they are super soft. The sound is a little different between these and my other Bose headphones (a little less bass) so you may need to play with the equalizer. Otherwise, awesome. I can now work without having to listen to surrounding co-workers chitty chatting about everything but work.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal R

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation causes buzz instead after few months of regular use.
customer_reviews.text: These are very good earphones and my second pair. Noise cancellation was awesome too until yesterday, when noise cancellation is switched on, All I hear is a buzz like the noise of wind on the other end of a phone call. Used it indoors for few months. Was sold by Amazon but when contacted I was told that they would not be able to help in matters of warranty. So printing invoice & warranty documents, plan to go visit a local store. Shall post updates if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Abhijeet Sarkar

customer_reviews.title: Love them!  Will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair in 15 years. I absolutely love them! I bought the first pair to use on an international flight. Now I use them for sleeping at night as well. They get used for several hours every day. The battery lasts +\- 12 hours at a time. My last pair only lasted for about 2 years before one of the ear pieces literally fell apart but again I also sleep with them in and I fight a lot in my sleep so no big surprise. Will definitely buy again when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Like all Bose Products Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The first pair was left on a Delta flight after using them frequently while flying. I have the Bose That fit over the ear and they are too hot for me. I love everything about these. I do wish the carry case was slightly larger so I didn’t have to wind the cord up so perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: B. McLauchlin

customer_reviews.title: Best in their class
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair (first lasted 5 years and 2nd were stolen), and I’ve never found their equal for any price. Amazing sound, amazing noise cancelation, highly portable, and incredibly comfortable. Couldn’t get any better!
customer_reviews.author: world winger

customer_reviews.title: Stops Working After 8 Months of Use
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds fit great once I figured out my size. The noise cancelling wasn't absolute, I could still hear loud street noises, but overall they worked well. Until they stopped working. After only 8 months of use, the left earphone started having static and creating thumping and scratchy noises that made it painful to wear. I was careful with them and kept them in a hard protective case. Frustrating to waste $250 if the product only works for 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kourtney Heintz

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I own several Bose products that I am completely happy with, which is why I was surprised to find these headphones do not meet the demands of the outdoors.... On a plane or noisey office environments they seem to work well, but take them outside into windy conditions or around traffic they are a failure. Popping and hissing as if the noise cancelling can't keep up with the surrounding aurel area. Sadly, I have to report that these headphones suck.
customer_reviews.author: JeffreySadis

customer_reviews.title: I like.
customer_reviews.text: I like this one. I use it on my daily bus ride to work and is nice to filter out some of the noise and of course sound is great. Some sounds are eliminated and when I take them off when I get to the office, the usually-quiet air conditioning seems loud. During my coffee break at the local shop, it quiets the espresso noise but some voices still show up, kind of like background. The little rectangular part that turns on/off the noise canceling seems a little clunky at first. The ear pieces are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Does everything it says.
customer_reviews.text: I am a million mile flier on one airline and almost on another. I've had dozens of earbuds including some sennheiser and sony noise canceling ones. I thought I was so clever saving all that money and not listening to the Bose pitch as I walked past their airport kiosks. I'm really not sure why I bought these but when I first put them on in an HVAC noisy hotel room I was shocked at how much they attenuated the background sounds. Now if I can not lose them...
customer_reviews.author: K Cornwinkle

customer_reviews.title: Probably great, but not made for iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the one labeled as “Made for IPhone” thinking that it would have a lightning connection because... well, it’s made for IPhone but now I have to wait for my adapter to show up. I have no problem with this product, just the marketing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Excellent noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones mostly for air travel. They are very comfortable in my ears, and cancel the drone of the airplane effectively, leaving crisp full sound of whatever I'm listening to. Unlike over-the-ear headphones, they are very compact, taking up only a tiny space in a carry-on bag. They are corded, which is still useful in planes in that they can plug in to the airplane's entertainment system as well as into my iPad. The battery life is plenty even for long flights of over 4 hours (perhaps longer, but I haven't tested the maximum battery life beyond 4 hours). Overall they perform just as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Beth M

customer_reviews.title: Great portability & packability, along with noise canceling.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these earphones strictly for air travel. I did not want to carry the standard large headphones that I see most people use. I don't travel that often but I like traveling as light as possible and so I wanted small, packable earphones that were also noise canceling. A year ago, when I purchased these headphones, there were a few other options that met my criteria. They get five stars for sound and five stars for their portability. As far as their noise canceling ability, they get four stars. They are not as good as the standard large headphones. However, because their sound is so good and portability/packability, for me, is five stars, I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: EzRamon

customer_reviews.title: Worked OK, but after 1 and half years of ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK, but after 1 and half years of light use, the right side speaker stopped working correctly - it lost the noise cancel function. Should work longer than that. Warranty is only 1 year...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound, cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones. They're excellent at what they do. But this was my second pair. They just don't hold up to normal wear and tear. I've had the wires pull out, the volume control break, the left ear bud break. They're just too expensive to replace every year.
customer_reviews.author: Stephyn G. W. Butcher

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without these
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. After a couple of years I broke my older ones much to my sadness. I looked around for something different but these are still the best noise cancelling IMO. I pretty much use them exclusively for travel on the airplane. I don't want a full over the ear set, I want them to be lightweight and small footprint in the carry on bag. I have used them on numerous domestic and international flights. The battery has even held up clear to India. I can't live without these in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Review after 6 months' use
customer_reviews.text: Was thrilled when I got it in Nov, 2016 the noise cancellation function worked great, canceled down almost all the outside noise , the sound quality was great and you'd see the huge difference between having the noise cancelation on or not. I would use this at night every day since I have the habit of listening to news or something to put me to sleep and it was really helpful in reducing my spouse's snoring sound. I've noticed something different lately when I can still hear the snoring, and it doesn't block as much of the traffic noise as it used to. Wonder how I can have it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Fitness4Life

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long flights
customer_reviews.text: I used these on a 16 hour flight and these helped me sleep on the plane. Once they were in my ears and the noise-canceling was turned on, the background noise completed melted away. The battery for noise canceling lasted the entire flight for me and I recharged them on my layover for the next flight. Not sure if I needed to, but I didn't want to risk having the battery die on the next flight. I did have to switch the rubber buds to the smaller size (included) which made them much more comfortable. I keep these with me ALL THE TIME now. Totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Janita

customer_reviews.title: These in-ear headphones are comfortable enough to leave in for the entire duration of ...
customer_reviews.text: These things are witchcraft. Magic. Sorcery. Put them on and the entire world just disappears. I've been a big Bose fan and owned a pair of the Bose QuietComfort 2 over-ear model. They worked well but were very bulky and -- for those of us who wear glasses -- a bit of a pain! These in-ear headphones are comfortable enough to leave in for the entire duration of an international flight, and fit easily in a pocket. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: Best on this planet
customer_reviews.text: The brand itself doesn't need much intro. If you don't know Bose yet, you may need some homework before buying any earphones. I can see not many people buying this now given the new wireless in-ear QC 25, and the round-ear 30 and 35. For me, an in-ear is preferred, and I trust that QC 20 has been around long enough to endure and absorb critiques and bug-fixes that make it a more reliable choice. The noise canceling function is no less than any round-ear ones, even if it's on a passive mode. It hasn't given me any trouble after purchasing and I think it's the best that you can get.
customer_reviews.author: NPR

customer_reviews.title: Good and portable
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Has been my portable earplug for airplane travels. Comparing to my old Sony over-the-ear noise canceling headphones, this is much more portable and easier to carry (despite this is wired, instead of bluetooth). However, one thing that I don't like very much is that the wire, when you are, say, turning around your head, the wire scratches your cloths and makes very noticeable noise in the headphone. It also sometimes tend to fall off my ear when turning my head.
customer_reviews.author: kid

customer_reviews.title: Love these earbuds!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these just prior to a 3-month trip involving 22 flights, trains, boats, tuk tuks, buses and more. Love them! What joy to flick the button and have the "cone of silence" envelope me. Comfortable, stay-put ear pieces. Long battery life. Great sound and terrific little size that takes up little room in my carry-on or purse. So much better suited to a long, luggage-conscious trip than my Bose headphones.
customer_reviews.author: R. Marchand

customer_reviews.title: Easy to take and work well
customer_reviews.text: I had over-the-ear noise cancelling headphones, which worked fine, but they took up so much room in my carry-on that I often debated whether to leave them at home. With these, the sound is just as good, the controls are better, and they are so small in their carrying case that you can take them anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: A must for air travel. Balanced sound signature.
customer_reviews.text: Must have for air travel. The noise cancelling is amazing and takes away all my feelings of motion sickness. The sound signature is great, excellent clarity, not very bright but beautifully balanced and flat with a natural sounding bass response that doesn’t feel artificial or enhanced. Love it. No listening fatigue and the most comfortable fit in ear with these.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed

customer_reviews.title: pricey, but good overall
customer_reviews.text: These were really indispensable on a couple of international flights recently. Even when just using the noise-cancelling feature without audio, they reduced engine noise, blathering strangers and even whiny kids to a faraway drone. Cons: they are expensive, and as many others have also noted, the cable between the jack and the battery pack/switch is awkwardly short. One other minor gripe is that the carrying case is almost too compact. It's so small that I have trouble fitting everything into it, so I've avoided using it for fear of damaging the headphones or wires.
customer_reviews.author: sandhobot

customer_reviews.title: One of the top five favorite things in my life!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I still use my first pair after four years of heavy use, but wanted a back up to keep in my daily bag. I keep the first pair on my nightstand. These are the best things for a good nights sleep! If you have street noise, hotel room noise, snoring sleep partners, these will help you shut out the world and get to sleep! My husband sometimes snores and these shut out that noise. They are comfortable enough that I can sleep in them on my side.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Stone

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it for those who value quiet over anything else
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but what price can you put on quiet? My wife loves these - she uses on long plane trips and also at the gym, and in both use cases raves about the noise cancelling ability of these headphones. They are also small enough in form factor that she can place in her carryon without the headphones taking up an inordinate amount of room. The sound quality is acceptable, though this is something she cares less about than the noise cancellation. To that end, they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: While I truly love them, I have a big issue with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to deduct one star because this is the second set I've owned. While I truly love them, I have a big issue with the design. I believe there is a flaw in the way the connector is constructed. It takes only a light drop and the connector can be bent in such a way that it renders the entire unit inoperable. Be careful to not let your device rest against the connector either. My recommendation for anyone considering a purchase, buy insurance. I did this time and I'm glad I have it...just in case.
customer_reviews.author: K. D. Abramson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Noisy College Dorm Rooms!
customer_reviews.text: Great for noisy dorm rooms! They are small enough to sleep in, and the little electronics 'package' (about the size of 2 sticks of gum) can be dropped inside your shirt. I've used them in hotels and on airplanes, and they just make the world 'go away'. They do better on rhythimic sounds like airplane engines or bass-beats from stereos 2 doors down the hall.
customer_reviews.author: A Practical Yankee Engineer

customer_reviews.title: All Engine Noise Not Cancelled
customer_reviews.text: I already owned a set of Bose noise canceling headphones that fit over the ears. They are great, but they are bulky and take up a lot of room in my small carry-on bag. I therefore decided to buy these, as they are much smaller. They aren't bad, but they do not keep out the noise of the airplane engines nearly as well as my other Bose headphones. My choice for each trip is which set to take, the ones that take up very little room but let noise in or the set that lets no noise in but is big and bulky
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Crays

customer_reviews.title: amazing!! i love their noise cancelling products
customer_reviews.text: amazing!! i love their noise cancelling products. i have the over the ears pair and also these in the ears. both have amazing quality, especially on airplanes. they do get a little warm in your ear after a few hours of use, but i have used them for up to 6-8 hours at a time and as long as i take them off when i take short breaks then they are fine to use for extended periods
customer_reviews.author: LED

customer_reviews.title: Bose is known for its amazing headphones, these noise canceling headphones work well
customer_reviews.text: Bose is known for its amazing headphones, these noise canceling headphones work well, not as good as over or on ear headphones for obvious reasons but these fit very comfortably and holds a long charge. it works without charge minus the noise canceling feature but still blocks out a lot of noise. the case fits the headphones well and i would be careful with tossing these in a bag because ive had many bose headphone wires break so wind them up loosely and store in case when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best Sleep
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancelling is top-notch. Since moving into the city, I haven't gotten great sleep because I am a sensitive sleeper (loud sirens and motorcycles all throughout the night). These work like a charm -- I can't even hear the heater in my apartment. You get what you pay for, and these are definitely worth the money. It also comes with 3 different sized ear buds, which is helpful if your ear is not standard sized. Fully charged, these last 16 hours, so more than enough to get you through the night. Note: I haven't tested out the music quality of the headphones, as my primary purpose was the noise-cancelling for sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Love Them and Sleep So Well!
customer_reviews.text: These things have saved my sleep! Combined with the White Noise app on my phone, I now sleep like a rock! Loud or odd noises, like my dogs barking, still come through and keep in connected in case I need to be awaken. Other than that, though, noises are cancelled or muffled, allowing me to get true white noise and sleep SO well! I started with the Medium ear pieces, then tried the Large version. The Large ones won. Point being, try the various sizes for your purposes and keep an open mind about the true size of your ear. Bose - THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This fits my ears great and I love how you don't have to squeeze it into the ear canal like other brands. The sound quality is plenty good for me and the noise cancellation is awesome. Better than others I've tried. It's pricey but if you are in a noisy environment or traveling more than a couple times a year, I think it's worth it...
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: but does nothing for instantaneous sounds like a horn
customer_reviews.text: Blocks out continuous tones, but does nothing for instantaneous sounds like a horn.
customer_reviews.author: Ian7

customer_reviews.title: Good but if you travel long distances - good chance you'll break them
customer_reviews.text: They do all they claim to do and the sound quality is excellent. Could be me but I've bent the aux cable twice. I survived it once but not the second time. On long flights to Europe or Asia, you have get up. If you forget to unplug them from the armrest, you'll bend them as you or your row mate passes. That's not their fault It'd be great if the cable were replaceable. The over the ear models I've had in the past have a removable replaceable aux cable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A

customer_reviews.title: Real effective, wish I had bought years ago.
customer_reviews.text: These were expensive but totally worth it. I travel a lot on long international flights and over the ear headphones were not only bulky, but the pressure on my head was giving me headaches. These are light as a feather and amazingly effective at noise suppression. You will have to buy a small additional Apple Lightning adapter to make them compatible with new iPhones that don't use the 3.5mm headphone jack if you want to use these to play music or talk using your iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Abe

customer_reviews.title: The perfect ear buds
customer_reviews.text: I splurged on these and I am so happy I did. I travel/fly a lot and I can definitely tell the difference when using the noice cancelling option. It makes all the difference when listening to music or watching a movie on a plane. You do not have to use noice cancelling and they work just like the high quality Bose product it is. But when there is background noise, these are a game changer. Extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Warm Fuzzies

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: I am huge fan of Bose products, technology, durability, last headphone I purchased were excellent but the plastic wire started to peel and look horrible and the copper was exposed so I stopped using it. This time, the silicon pushes started to be deteriorate and very soon I will need replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed rashid

customer_reviews.title: Good noise cancellation; very comfortable; sound quality is above average.
customer_reviews.text: I have to echo some of the reviews here and say that these are great earphones; they fit really well in ear, and sound great. Noise cancellation is also top notch, as I use them regularly at work, even without any sound, just to cancel out some of the chatter noise around me. The audio quality is also good, but not great; definitely above average. Overall, I'm very satisfied with the purchase, and I'm hoping these will last. Purchased in May 2017.
customer_reviews.author: Iago

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cancel noise much
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good, but the noise canceling not so much. I went to a McDonalds to test the noise canceling. I turned the canceling on and off (yes it was fully charged), and there was a slight lessening of the environmental sound, so I know it was doing SOMETHING, but not much to speak of. Certainly not worth the price. Waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but excellent. I take them every time I fly.
customer_reviews.text: Advantages: Excellent product. The sound is very good. The noise cancellation is excellent. After using for a year or two I bought a 2nd pair for my wife, along with a splitter so we can watch and listen to phone videos together . I would highly recommend this if you are flying. Disadvantages: They are pricey. They are wired, therefore if you want to use it with you newer iPhone, you need to buy a lightning connector dongle for about $10.00.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lando

customer_reviews.title: 1st one made a clicking in my left ear.  Amazon Replaced
customer_reviews.text: The first Bose clicked in my left ear whenever I moved my head Very annoying. I tried it twice and it continued to do this. Amazon agreed--actually offered-- to replace it even though I was past the 30 days. Happy with this one. Consumer beware--always try things out when you get them. Amazon can only do so much to help protect you, you have to be proactive and return an item if it does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Best in ear, noise cancelling plugs
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancelling is the best I have ever used, really filters outside noise. Additionally, they are very comfortable inside your ear. I like them so much, these ones were a replacement for the ones I lost recently. Think that is the best proof of how much I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L.

customer_reviews.title: He said the 12-hour flight home was the best flight he'd ever had
customer_reviews.text: My husband received these headphones as a gift while overseas. He said the 12-hour flight home was the best flight he'd ever had. I was skeptical; couldn't imagine they were that amazing. He had me use them while I mowed the grass (riding lawn tractor, John Deere, pretty loud). I was completely amazed at the sound quality and noise cancellation. Our dog got into his office about a week later and loved them so much she ate them :( I've just purchased a replacement set for our anniversary. They are very expensive, but worth every penny, especially if you travel.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Love my Bose
customer_reviews.text: Replacing the previous version of these, which I lost somewhere while traveling (ugh). I love these on planes as they cut out the drone of the engines. It's not complete silence, but it's a huge improvement in my opinion. I've also slept in them from time to time if I end up in a hotel room with street noise. A charge lasts a long time (trans Atlantic flight is no problem).
customer_reviews.author: Glass

customer_reviews.title: the 25's were slightly better at canceling noise
customer_reviews.text: Was between these and the Quiet Comfort 25's, which I also bought to compare. I had to get used to the feeling of the headphones sitting on my head but ultimately, the 25's were slightly better at canceling noise, so I kept them. The sound quality is also better in the 25's. At $250, these felt too similar to regular headphones, maybe one step up, to justify the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Olga P.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but poor build quality.
customer_reviews.text: I found the overall sound quality and noise-canceling to be very good. However, what is unfortunate is the cables started to fray after about a year of fairly frequent use. From reading other reviews, it seems I am not the only one with this issue. This is my 2nd pair that have had this happen. Both wires on each side started fraying where they attach to the ear bud. Once it started the fraying progressed rapidly. This is a fairly high-end product at a high end price by Bose so I expected higher quality, not a 1.5yr product life.
customer_reviews.author: Ira

customer_reviews.title: Blocks noise. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: A must if you are noise sensitive living in an apartment, ever travel by plane or bus, etc. These block it all or muffle it to bearable levels. Neighbor noise & coworker noise in particular is completely blocked out (walking overhead, TV noise, talking, etc.). Listen to music or watch a movie with these in & the noise canceling turned on, and the world could blow up. You’d never hear it. This is my second pair. The first I used constantly for over 5 years (Many hours a day at work and then at home 7 days a week). I kinda destroyed those and will be more careful this time around. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: R. B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: This item is getting a 3 stars by default only because is a Bose product. However, there isn’t much of a difference between this item and the $99.95 soundsport wireless headphones when it comes to sound quality. What is does for sure is add a lot of cables and gadgets to it. It felt overwhelming to walk around with all the additional items attached to the cables. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE A.

customer_reviews.title: Not for snoring
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husbands snoring. I had to turn them up so loud that the noise kept me awake. They also hurt my ears. Bose makes a product for sleeping so I am trying that now.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Earphones don't cancel out human voices
customer_reviews.text: As most reviews note, these earphones do a good job at cancelling background noises, particularly low-pitched noises (e.g., heavy beats in disco music, airplane sounds). They barely decrease the sounds of human voices (talking, singing). I can easily hear announcements on airplanes, or singing of music at the gym, even while they almost eliminate the rumble of a plane or music accompanying singing, particularly deep base). I ran some tests at home with various sorts of music, including songs. Disappointing for the cost since I had anticipated they would cancel out voices, too. It's as if they were designed to allow human voices in. Others have noted this characteristic.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Chenier

customer_reviews.title: I was seeking a major reduction in wind noise when riding my motorcycle.
customer_reviews.text: In wind noise reduction this product is the 'silver bullet' it works as advertised and I'm so happy to have finally found a product that substantially reduces wind noise while riding my motorcycle. Although not designed specifically for motorcycle riding I wish the control switch gear was larger and more robust for outdoor use. As a suggestion to Bose, perhaps as an option the wiring strength could be increased via 'strain relief' support, waterproofing, and larger easier to use switch gear when wearing gloves could be incorporated into such an optional cost item.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Harris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality and noise canceling. And you can sleep on your side!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for air travel. Very good sound, battery life and noise canceling. And since they fit in your ear, you can sleep on your side. I've recently paired with TaoTronics Bluetooth 5.0 Transmitter ( which almost makes them wireless.
customer_reviews.author: James Jacovides

customer_reviews.title: Snore-cancelling
customer_reviews.text: I got this in- ear style so that I could sleep with them and hopefully drown out my husbands snoring when we travel. It did a pretty good job of that although not totally comfortable to sleep with. If you want better noise cancelling I think the over the ear models work better.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy K Brown

customer_reviews.title: The best part
customer_reviews.text: I discovered an unexpected aspect of these earbuds. Our Honda accord has a lot of road noise from the tires. I decided to try this system as a means to reduce the ambient noise of the car. What I discovered was that most of the noise went away and surprisingly I now could easily, actually more easily, carry on a conversation with others in the car. I am reasonably sure that Bose does not recommend wearing these while driving. But I have found it actually increases my awareness of traffic. In fact, I often just put them in the ears and turn on the noise canceling. Aahhh, The almost "sounds of silence".
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: They do a great job on the airplane and if needed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after I lost my over the ear Bose noise cancelling headphones. I believe the noise cancellation is slightly less than their larger alternative HOWEVER, I travel a lot and for me the portability is a bigger priority. They do a great job on the airplane and if needed, I can easily sleep with these in my ears in the hotels, while with the large headphones I could not.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: Very Satified
customer_reviews.text: I was suspicious that an in-the-ear headphone would work, but I really like these. There are some sounds that still come through (my husband whistling for one) but at least these are muffled. Really good on humming/vibration noises, so I expect them to be great on airplanes.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer MacLean

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I had the noise cancelling Bose headphones but I fly every week and they were too big to easily carry. I noticed other passengers using these and so I got them to try. I'm very happy with them. They do a solid job of knocking out the airplane noise and music and movies sound great through them. You just have to remember to charge them up before you head out.
customer_reviews.author: Big Cheeta

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: As with almost every other Bose product I've encountered, this one BROKE - right ear speaker came apart. Noise cancelling makes a scream in your ear sound - its mechanics is also broken. This happened pretty much on the one year anniversary of when I bought them in Feb 2017. Broke Feb 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie C

customer_reviews.title: but some nice quietness to make studying/relaxing possible at home is priceless
customer_reviews.text: Helped block 80% of barking of the neighbors' dogs. It's pricey, but some nice quietness to make studying/relaxing possible at home is priceless. Will update this review on how well it lasts. Some reviews said it broke/stopped working after a while. I love dogs, but when you've got 5+ dogs in the block barking when they feel bored/scared/lonely/whatever at night... (face-palm)
customer_reviews.author: F. Z.

product_meta.title: Bose QuietComfort 20 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones, Apple Devices, Black
product_meta.description: Style:Apple devices| Color:BlackShut out the world and lose yourself in your music or hear what's around you. It's your choice with the first in ear noise cancelling headphones from Bose. Quiet Comfort 20 Acoustic Noise Cancelling headphones are engineered to let you enjoy better sound every day, everywhere you go. Turn on noise cancelling to reduce surrounding distractions and focus on your music. Or, at the touch of a button, activate aware mode so you can hear what's happening around you without removing the headphones. Inside, exclusive TriPort technology brings your music to life while additional Bose technologies provide dramatic noise cancellation rivaling any full sized headphone on the market today. Proprietary Stay Hear+ tips create a soft, secure fit. The inline microphone and remote let you switch to calls on your iPhone, and provide control for select iPod, iPhone and iPad models. The rechargeable lithium ion battery provides up to 16 hours of use. And even when the power is off or the battery runs out, you can still use these headphones to enjoy Bose quality sound. Included: Quiet Comfort 20 headphones; 3 pairs Stay Hear+ tips (S, M, L); clothing clip; rechargeable lithium ion battery (built in); USB charging cable; carrying case. Battery life: 16 hours per full charge.
feature_bullets: Compatible Devices: iPhone, iPad and iPod models
Included Components: QuietComfort 20 headphonesApple devices, 3 pairs StayHear+ tips (S, M, L), Clothing clip, Rechargeable lithium-ion battery (built-in), USB charging cable, Carrying case

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,631 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
